tool.name: Gtool conversion from gen/sample to ped/map
tool.description: Converts gen/sample files from imputation to PED/MAP files.

param.name: input_gen
param.label: Gen input file
param.help: This is your genotype file in .gen format.

param.name: input_sample
param.label: Sample input file
param.help: This is your sample file in .sample format.

param.name: phenotype
param.label: Name of Phenotype
param.help: If the phenotype does not exist or you don't wish to set a phenotype, the phenotype is given a value of -9 in the PED file.

param.name: threshold
param.label: Call threshold
param.help: In the GEN format each SNP is represented as a set of three probabilities which correspond to the allele pairs AA,AB,BB. If the largest of the probabilities is over the threshold specified, then the genotype in the PED file is expressed as the corresponding allele pair. The genotypes are expressed as pairs of 1,2,0. If none of the probabilities are over the calling threshold then the pair is unknown, 0 0. This should allow the conversion of indels and other biallelic structural variants from the 1000 Genomes.

param.name: sex
param.label: Name of sex column
param.help: The name of the sex column in the SAMPLE file is specified using this value. If unspecified will look for a column named 'sex' or 'gender'. If no column is found then the sex column in the PED file will be set to -9.

tool.help:
This tool converts gen/sample files into ped/map files.
Thanks to the creators of Gtool (http://www.well.ox.ac.uk/~cfreeman/software/gwas/gtool.html) for helping to do the file conversion.
